body:
Please respect the commit guidelines: https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md

You will need to create a JIRA and prepend the commit with the jira issue number, e.g. `[AIRFLOW-1925]`.
Ok, thanks @yangaws
Would it be possible to test this?
@Fokko done: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-2713

Thank you for this @mastoj , but I would like to request you to add this to all the BQ related operators at the least and if possible all the GCP related OPs at max.
@caddac Please check the commit guidelines. The commit title is still unclear. `add confirm option` to what?
@Noremac201 Can you resolve the failing tests?
@dimberman PTAL
@feng-tao, @jgao54 , @mistercrunch  I would be interested in helping with the follow-up features of this pull request. Is their anyway I can join you guys into it?
@kaxil LGTM, thanks for catching this @mrkm4ntr !

@gerardo  Please let me know if there is anything I can do to help. I really want this feature :)
@bolkedebruin @fokko could we keep a base image somewhere to pull from? If we had an image with all expected libraries pre-installed it would cut image build times significantly.

Please squash commits
@kaxil Thank you for the guidance, the commit message has been updated.

@kaxil added labels where I think it make sense for the bigquery related operators. I don't think it applies to all the bigquery operators, or, I could find it in the docs for bigquery at least. I didn't add it to all the GCP related now.
I see the build is failing, but I'm not sure why. It previously built and the error doesn't appear to be related to the changes I made.
Hey! Any updates here @benjamingregory and @briandconnelly?
Great improvement!

not sure if it is related to this pr, but get bunches of UI errors even after running airflow resetdb with master branch: 
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,267] {manager.py:231} ERROR - Add Permission: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission.name [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission (name) VALUES (?)'] [parameters: ('can_get_logs_with_metadata',)]
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,298] {manager.py:231} ERROR - Add Permission: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission.name [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission (name) VALUES (?)'] [parameters: ('can_get_logs_with_metadata',)]
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,336] {manager.py:341} ERROR - Creation of Permission View Error: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission_view.permission_id, ab_permission_view.view_menu_id [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission_view (permission_id, view_menu_id) VALUES (?, ?)'] [parameters: (6, 21)]

[2018-07-05 14:41:14,344] {manager.py:386} ERROR - Add Permission to Role Error: Can't flush None value found in collection Role.permissions
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,350] {manager.py:341} ERROR - Creation of Permission View Error: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission_view.permission_id, ab_permission_view.view_menu_id [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission_view (permission_id, view_menu_id) VALUES (?, ?)'] [parameters: (6, 21)]
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,356] {manager.py:386} ERROR - Add Permission to Role Error: Can't flush None value found in collection Role.permissions
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,384] {manager.py:341} ERROR - Creation of Permission View Error: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission_view.permission_id, ab_permission_view.view_menu_id [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission_view (permission_id, view_menu_id) VALUES (?, ?)'] [parameters: (57, 21)]
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,387] {manager.py:341} ERROR - Creation of Permission View Error: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission_view.permission_id, ab_permission_view.view_menu_id [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission_view (permission_id, view_menu_id) VALUES (?, ?)'] [parameters: (57, 21)]
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,389] {manager.py:386} ERROR - Add Permission to Role Error: Can't flush None value found in collection Role.permissions
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,392] {manager.py:386} ERROR - Add Permission to Role Error: Can't flush None value found in collection Role.permissions
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,399] {manager.py:341} ERROR - Creation of Permission View Error: (sqlite3.IntegrityError) UNIQUE constraint failed: ab_permission_view.permission_id, ab_permission_view.view_menu_id [SQL: 'INSERT INTO ab_permission_view (permission_id, view_menu_id) VALUES (?, ?)'] [parameters: (57, 21)]
[2018-07-05 14:41:14,404] {manager.py:386} ERROR - Add Permission to Role Error: Can't flush None value found in collection Role.permissions

Don’t think this is related to this PR. The error looks similar to what Joy
reported when discussing the pr that deletes web server app creation in the
main process( this looks like the app Builder is trying to insert an
existing permission entry which happens at the app creation time). Are you
running a clean master branch or you rebased to master? I recalled that you
have included that change that delete app creation, can you check if that
change is still in?( Sorry I don’t have access to my laptop or I’ll check
myself).

PTAL @kaxil @Fokko
@ricardo-bion I've tested the rpy2-based operator a few times with success, but haven't had much time lately to test it further or make test cases for it.

Sorry for the radio silence on my end. Wasn't able to test way back in and fell to the wasteland of my to-do unfortunately.

Completely booked for the next two weeks so anyone else feel free to jump in if available for testing.
jenkins pass at my repo: https://travis-ci.com/feng-tao/incubator-airflow/builds/78245048
Thanks @feng-tao ! This feature is really amazing! Thank you for this!
hey @jensenity , @jgao54  is the one who implemented RBAC feature....

@kaxil I also made the labels for bigquery a template field, since I realize there is a need to be able to create labels based on the runtime information. I'll add a separate PR that adds the same thing for dataflow.

You're right, I've reverted that back.
Would like to get this in if possible, the changes can be removed from the rbac stuff if they aren't available to review.
I'd probably have an `def await` conditionally defined when <Py3.7 that issues a deprecation warning, and something in UPDATING.md
This is now conflicting cos #3561 fixed the setup.py already. I'n closing your Jira as a duplicate of AIRFLOW-2713, but the other bits of this PR are still needed.
Could you add some tests that directly call `wwwutils.get_python_source` with one case for each type?
Can you rebase onto master?
LGTM http://werkzeug.pocoo.org/docs/0.14/contrib/fixers/#werkzeug.contrib.fixers.ProxyFix
hey @Fokko , sorry, just updated the commit message.
@caddac I don't think the failing build is related to your changes.
I would expect that the `self.execution_date` already has a timezone. @bolkedebruin any thoughts?
It isn't clean. If you look at the Files tab, you see a lot of files changed related to GCP. That doesn't make sense.
@jrderuiter can you add high available support?

@feng-tao `-59.01%` coverage in the Codecov report above is pretty concerning. I'm surprise that removing a few tests would ever contribute to dropping coverage that bad.
@saguziel ^^^
LGTM

@mistercrunch , I think I just turned off the following two tests:
```test_mark_success_no_kill` (not run for mysql)``` and ```test_change_state_for_tis_without_dagrun```

And for my pr(1300+) line, I think 500 line ~ 600 line are test. I doubt it could drop the project coverage by 59%. If I would guess, I modify the app.py interface to add session as input argument for better testing purpose which triggers something non test code...

Looking at the coverage report(https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-airflow/commit/f0b4d6c0ea22214c9c2396d03153317cd082017f), I am not sure if it is correct(hash code is the same as my commit, and it shows www_rbac/views.py coverage is 0...)
@bolkedebruin I've re-added the ability to have a different user realm, with a twist: if "security.default_realm" doesn't exist, we revert to "kerberos.default_realm".

hey @mistercrunch , I trigger another code coverage report(https://codecov.io/gh/feng-tao/incubator-airflow/pull/9/diff) on the pull request in my local repo which shows coverage is 77%. I create a new pr which is same as this one(https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/3582) and see if we could trigger a new coverage report.
@ashb Since this is a SyntaxError, we can't add a conditional definition, but I'll add something to UPDATING.md and rebase.

One somewhat hacky way to add a warning though would be to add a `__getattr__` that checks for an `await` attribute name and raise the warning there and call `wait` instead. That would work for py <3.7 users, but still raise a `SyntaxError` at the call site for 3.7.

Oh right, and it'll parse the entire file of course.

`setattr` on the class should work:

```
import warnings
from zope.deprecation import deprecation
class Foo():
    def wait(self):
        print("foo")

# We can do this in all versions
setattr(Foo, 'await', deprecation.deprecated(Foo.wait, 'renamed to wait for Python3.7 compatability'))


# Just for test - airflow already does this
warnings.filterwarnings(action='default', category=DeprecationWarning, module=__name__)

Foo().await()
```

When run that will print:

```
foo.py:11: DeprecationWarning: renamed to wait for
  Foo().await()
foo
```

This doesn't help at the call-site (`Foo().await()`) which is still a syntax error, but lets us define a deprecated version for earlier versions of python without it causing a syntax error there.
I think that test was flaky, could it be re-run?

It looks like it is compiling some C-extensions used by lxml. Apart from that I don't see any objects to update this to a more recent version.

@ashb replying to your questions:

> What is the advantage of moving some of the JS code from inline to a file? For instance the clock snippet/clock.js is basically unchanged.

A couple of advantages of doing that. 
- We'd be able combine our javascript and all the dependencies (like d3.js, nvd3.js) in one single minified chunk, which would be efficient and improve the page load time. 
- Write the test cases of our JS code by using separate files. 

> Secondly: with this change does it mean we can't just checkout the repo and run the (RBAC) webserver? (I'm not sure if that's a problem per se, I just want to check)

As a contributor, if you want to contribute in the repo, you'll need to compile the javascript at least once, using `npm run build` and it will remain in your `static/dist/`. I've also added the details in Contributing guidelines on how to build the JS code. But it would be great to rebuild everytime you pull the lates code from master branch, just to make sure you are completely synced with all the new libraries/packages.
(If you'll make changes in javascript then for every change you'll need to recompile javascript, or use `npm run dev` to automatically compile JS on every change).

@ashb Thanks for clarifying.  If I'm reading the regex correctly, then adding the dot via this PR makes it consistent with that PEP, right?

In the usage of both of these objects, `poll` is the only method that is not shared between `psutil.Process`, `psutil.Popen`, and `subprocess.Popen`. I cannot find a common function for this purpose between `psutil.Process` and `subprocess.Popen`.

`psutil.Popen` is a convenience wrapper around `subprocess.Popen` that adds methods provided by `psutil.Process`.

As an alternative, in this case:

```python
gunicorn_master_proc = psutil.Popen(run_args, close_fds=True)
```

could have been written as:

```python
gunicorn_master_subproc = psutil.Popen(run_args, close_fds=True)
gunicorn_master_proc = psutil.Process(gunicorn_master_subproc.pid)
```

but that seems needlessly verbose.

I support the idea of migrating `subprocess.Popen` calls to `psutil.Popen` but feel that would be a larger undertaking and would prefer to do that as more of a search/replace separate from functional changes like this `poll` -> `wait` change.
